jobTitle: Critical Facilities Engineer - Data Center Operations
jobDescription: As a Critical Facilities Engineer, you will work on a team responsible for facility planning, design, installation and upgrading of all Critical Facilities Infrastructure Systems for the Verisign Critical Facility network. Responsibilities: Provide logistical and engineering support for data center services, tracking and analyzing space, power and cooling requirements for data center applications Project planning, reporting and vendor management capabilities Produce commissioning, certification and testing checklists, certifying facility life safety systems, security, power and environmental systems Verify that all relevant systems are wired in and supervised by our Network Operations Center (NOC) Review and interpret electrical, mechanical and architectural drawings, review As-Built drawings, produce Statements of Work, manage contracts, obtain and review bids for equipment vital for maintenance & construction projects Participate in site project surveys, identifying structural, power, and HVAC, security, and 0perations facility requirements 7PM-7AM shift rotation Requirements: AS degree in Engineering (Electrical, Mechanical or Telecommunications), Technical School, or equivalent job-related experience 5+ years in the telecom or related industry experience, with emphasis on facility engineering maintenance, power and mechanical systems engineering & operations Ability to effectively communicate and interface with internal and external personnel Possess a level of understanding of the technology and functional to properly identify and prioritize risks and issues Solid understanding of various power and mechanical HVAC systems, 480 v 3 phase utility power, crucial diesel engine generator systems, critical UPS systems and - 48 volt dc power plant systems and chiller plants so as to be able to operate and determine \ forecasted loads for the purpose of maintaining, sizing and designing power and mechanical systems required to support critical facilities & data centers. Plan and engineer complete power and HVAC systems to construct new and expand existing facilities within the Verisign network Prefer knowledge and experience in the use of Building Management Systems (BMS) and Energy Power Management Systems (EPMS)

Verisign enables the security, stability, and resiliency of key internet infrastructure and services, including providing root zone maintainer services, operating two of the 13 global internet root servers, and providing registration services and authoritative resolution for the .com and .net top-level domains, which support the majority of global e-commerce. The Payroll Analyst processes Verisign's payrolls and compiles and audits payroll data to maintain accurate payroll records. Key Responsibilities Maintains payroll records for Verisign employees in the Verisign payroll system; updates and validates all changes in pay rates, benefits/ deductions, banking information and tax withholding information. Ensures that the current payroll information is submitted to Verisign's outsourced payroll vendor accurately and in a timely manner. Runs and distributes pay cycle reports to cross-functional business partners Prepares and posts journal entries for payroll into the accounting system. Responds to employee payroll inquiries. Reconciles payroll deposits, tax withholdings, wage garnishments and voluntary deductions. Education and Experience High School or GED required 5 years of payroll and related experience, required Skills Good understanding of payroll principles, practices, regulations, and procedures General knowledge of accounting and understanding of the general ledger accounts Strong communicator with customer service experience and excellent attention to detail Accomplished in operating a PC and using Microsoft Office Suite

Verisign enables the security, stability, and resiliency of key internet infrastructure and services, including providing root zone maintainer services, operating two of the 13 global internet root servers, and providing registration services and authoritative resolution for the .com and .net top-level domains, which support the majority of global e-commerce. Verisign is currently looking for a Senior Systems Engineer to join our ServiceNow and Audit & Compliance team. The role is a full stack software development position focused on ServiceNow development, architecture, integrations, workflows, and administration delivering the overall platform and the entire inventory, audit, and compliance portfolio. Auditing & Compliance provides complete IT Asset / configurable item auditing and compliance for all deployed systems and technology. The Senior Systems Engineer utilizes high level technical knowledge of software, hardware, networks and storage to collaborate across the organization to develop, design, test, and support Service Now and other core infrastructure components, focusing on reliability, availability and scalability of infrastructure. Key Responsibilities: ServiceNow development and administration Develop, maintain, and enhance applications on the ServiceNow platform Build and maintain workflows, integrations, service catalog, service portal Inventory asset and CMDB management, auditing, and compliance Ensure the smooth operation of the asset inventory audit database: Identify unexpected database load and mitigate or remediate as needed Fail over as needed to one of the three secondaries Monitoring queues, audit and compliance processes Assist with asset compliance related support: Help users identify deficiencies and remediate them Keep atop infrastructure updates and provide client packages or audit tools as needed Add new features to the auditing clients as needed: Enhancements may come from users or from a business need, and need to be incorporated into the client Add code as needed to load the newly collected data into the audit database Provide leadership and technical direction to members of the team Develop deep understanding of tie-ins with other systems and platforms Ensure key technical design documentation is provided and maintained Improve the health of system assets. Troubleshoot and lead root-cause analysis for system failures and recommend fixes/improvements to prevent their recurrence. Lead or participate in code reviews, design reviews, offering guidance on best practices to continuously improve stability and efficiencies Required qualifications: ServiceNow development, administration and integration experience Full Stack engineer with experience in advanced object-oriented languages Linux and OS skills Understands the importance of and values improving processes and systems, and enjoys auditing Preferred qualifications: Experience with Python, React, Perl, JavaScript, PostgreSQL, Ansible, Terraform, OpenStack, Kubernetes Familiar with VMware, AIX, and KVM virtualization technologies and how to practically audit them Experience in a zero-trust environment Exposure to collaboration tools such as SharePoint, Confluence and Jira Agile Engineering and Agile Scrum Methodology Web UI experience Experience and Educational Qualifications: 10+ years relevant experience 4-year Bachelorâ€™s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent work experience, required Graduate degree experience in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field, preferred
